intro: Sarcomphalus divaricatus, commonly known as the zigzag or variable sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with slender, triangular stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typically found in clusters at the tips of the stems. It thrives in wet or moist environments such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. Sarcomphalus divaricatus is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to tolerate fluctuating water levels.
